meanings.sent1: She upthrows the ball high into the air.
meanings.sent2: He upthrows the paper airplane and watches it soar.
meanings.sent3: The magician upthrows the scarf, making it disappear into the sky.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind upthrows the leaves, swirling them around.
meanings.sent5: The excited child upthrows his hands in joy as he jumps.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing upward or upwardly
meanings.sent1: The upthrows of confetti added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: His upthrows of rocks created ripples in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The upthrows of coins at the fountain brought good luck to many.
meanings.sent4: The upthrows of petals at the wedding were a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The upthrows of snow from the plow covered the sidewalk quickly.
